alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Judith Basin; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 08 at 2:24PM MST until March 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches at lower elevations, with 4 to 9 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Very cold wind chill temperatures to 25 and 30 below zero. * WHERE...Lewis and Clark County and the Rocky Mountain Front, Cascade, and Judith Basin. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. Dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A brief period of heavy snow is expected at the onset of the snow. Rapid accumulations and a flash freeze will likely accompany this heavy snow.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
